conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: extruded walls with thickness, angled/isometric viewpoint, and ceiling removed exposing interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; clean cutaway and mostly consistent 3D corner geometry. Minor simplification/softening of some edges reduces strict architectural crispness.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall program layout matches (two bedrooms, bath/core rooms, living area, dining/kitchen) with broadly correct adjacencies. However, the 3D outer perimeter is notably altered (curved/rounded right side vs rectilinear plan), and some room proportions/partition lengths appear shifted compared with the 2D drawing.

interior_elements.notes: Living/dining and kitchen elements exist; bathroom has fixtures; bedrooms have beds/wardrobes. Several items differ from the 2D plan (e.g., left bedroom appears to lose the two-single-bed arrangement; right bedroom desk/bed configuration is simplified/changed).

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clean and readable with good lighting and minimal artifacts. Openings and wall/floor separation are visible; presentation is uncluttered.

detected_errors.description: Exterior boundary shape deviates from the 2D plan (notably rounded/curved right side and softened corners), impacting strict layout fidelity.
Doors/windows are simplified; several openings are not clearly placed/represented as in the 2D plan (door swings and some window locations/sizes are ambiguous).
Furniture configuration does not consistently match the 2D plan (bed counts/types and some room-specific items like desk arrangements appear altered).

summary: A valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong volumetric readability, but with noticeable perimeter/proportion deviations and simplified opening/furniture fidelity versus the 2D plan.
